summary: The Critical Infrastructure Manufacturing Feasibility Act directs the Secretary of Commerce to study the feasibility of manufacturing products for critical infrastructure sectors within the United States. The study, to be completed within one year of enactment, will identify products in high demand that are imported due to domestic constraints. It will analyze the costs and benefits of domestic production, including effects on jobs and costs, identify feasible products for US manufacturing, and assess manufacturing in rural and industrial areas. A report to Congress, including recommendations, is due within 18 months, with a public version available online. The bill also defines critical infrastructure sectors as per Presidential Policy Directive 21.
